clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Augmented Renal Clearance on Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Properties of Levetiracetam in Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Augmented Renal Clearance on Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Properties of Levetiracetam in Subarachnoid Hemorrhage

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the pharmacokinetic profile of levetiracetam in critically ill patients who have suffered a subarachnoid hemorrhage. The patients will be evaluated for development of augmented renal clearance and the effects and duration of effects this may have on levetiracetam clearance.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in systemic levetiracetam clearance over time
primary_outcome.description: calculated systemic levetiracetam clearance (based on plasma concentrations) within 48 hours of initial presentation to the neurointensive care unit and every 5 days thereafter up to 20 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in urinary clearance of levetiracetam and creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: 12-hour urine collections on day 0, 5, 10, 15, and 20, calculated creatinine based on 12-hour urine collections daily for 7 days following diagnosis of vasospasm, and calculation of direct renal clearance of levetiracitam based on urine collection

intervention.description: Timed blood draws and urine collections to model drug clearance

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have suffered a non-traumatic subarachnoid hemorrhage requiring strict intake and output monitoring and admission to the neuro-intensive care unit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with non-traumatic subarachnoid hemorrhage requiring levetiracetam for seizure prophylaxis or treatment
- Presentation to University of Colorado Hospital within 48 hours of subarachnoid hemorrhage
- Adults ages 18 to 89 years
- Anticipated length of stay ≥ 48 hours
- Informed consent provided by the patient or patient's designated medical proxy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Patients receiving renal replacement therapy
- Brain death or imminent brain death expected ≤48 hours
- Patient with history of nephrectomy or renal transplant
